Comment:
Hi everyone!

Found this old game to give me and Master Freddy's long-suffering opponents some inspiration.  I take my hat off to Pearl, the Class C player in this game and I am about to play through it to see how she managed to overcome The Master Mater who was an Expert at the time this game was played.  Freddy kicks off with the Reti Opening which is Nf3 - this move develops a piece and hits out at e5.
2. c4 - transposes into an English Opening.

6. Be2 - with such a lead in development I bet you are wondering, how on earth does black manage to pull off an Expert Victory?  Well, read on.

19. Bxg4 - black trades her lsb for the knight on g4 to prevent her castled position being busted by Nxf6.  The move also clears the back row for black.  White has a terrific positional advantage though - it still seems inconceivable that he will end up on the losing side.
